result.execSummary:
The defendant Vickie L Waldrop was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation may be transferred to Alabama to the extent that they will accept this probation.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically a psychological evaluation and follow through with treatment recommendations. Must specifically maintain compliance with AA meetings. May not handle, in any fashion outside of the home, prescriptive medications for other people. May not consume any prescriptive medications of her father. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA  surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vickie L Waldrop

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DOC-notice of court ordered financial obligations status - balance due on court ordered financial obligations $518.00.  Defendant due to discharge 01-15-2018.

Defendant Vickie L Waldrop in court with attorney Keith David O'Donnell.  Defendant Vickie L Waldrop in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Parties reviewed PSI. No additions or corrections by the State. Defense puts corrections on the record. The State asks for incarceration and for CFTS for time served here as well as time served in Alabama.

BTC: sent w/held - 2 yrs prob. Probation may be transferred to Alabama to the extent that they will accept this probation.

Defendant Vickie L Waldrop in court with attorney Keith David O'Donnell.  Defendant Vickie L Waldrop in custody.  Sharon Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense asks for COP  Plea hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 11:30 am.
Notice of 10/2/15 Hearing to deft - Return to sender - Attempted not known; unable to forward.

Defendant Vickie L Waldrop in court with attorney Keith David O'Donnell.  Defendant Vickie L Waldrop in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Vickie L Waldrop in court with attorney Keith David O'Donnell.  Defendant Vickie L Waldrop in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Warrant forwarded to RCSO for entry.
Defendant Vickie L Waldrop not in court.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  No appearance, Bench/Arrest Warrant requested/ordered, bond forfeited.
